item.title: New Call Of Duty DLC Benefits LA Wildfire Relief Efforts
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/new-call-of-duty-dlc-benefits-la-wildfire-relief-efforts/1100-6528920/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Players of Call of Duty: Warzone and Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 can now contribute to relief efforts in the wake of the fires that recently devastated Los Angeles.

Both games now allow players to purchase a stylish cosmetic bundle called the LA Fire Relief Pack, which includes a character skin and matching weapon skin. All proceeds from purchases of the bundle will go to fire relief efforts in LA, and will be split evenly between two charities: the Los Angeles Fire Department Foundation (LAFD) and Direct Relief.

In the wake of the devastating fires in Los Angeles impacting our friends, colleagues and residents in Southern California, we’re adding the LA Fire Relief pack to Black Ops 6 and Call of Duty: Warzone.
100% of Activision’s proceeds from purchases of the LA Fire Relief pack will… pic.twitter.com/aEQ3Aq4QW6

— Call of Duty (@CallofDuty) January 18, 2025

"These donation efforts from Activision are to help support fire relief efforts, also giving the Call of Duty community an opportunity to get involved with helping those affected by the Los Angeles fires," Activision said in a recent press release. "Players can purchase the LA Fire Relief Pack across all platforms, which offers a robust amount of new game content for players to enjoy, while also directly supporting the cause."

According to their respective websites, The Los Angeles Fire Department Foundation "provides vital equipment and funds critical programs to help the LAFD save lives and protect communities," and Direct Relief "equips health professionals in resource-poor communities to meet the challenges of diagnosing, treating and caring for people in need." Both charities accept direct donation via their official websites.

Activision has also directly donated a total of $1 million to fire relief funds in LA, but it isn't the only games publisher to take action in the wake of the fires. Riot Games and Sony have recently begun firefighting fundraising efforts of their own.

item.title: Fatal Fury: City Of The Wolves Is Up For Preorder, Including PS5-Exclusive Deluxe Edition
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fatal-fury-city-of-the-wolves-is-up-for-preorder-including-ps5-exclusive-deluxe-edition/1100-6528820/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

SNK's long-dormant fighting game series Fatal Series returns with Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves, which launches on PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on April 24, 2025. The new game marks the first entry in the series in 26 years, and starting today, fans can preorder the game now. There are multiple versions of Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves available, including digital and physical versions, and even a Deluxe Edition packed with collectible extras. Preordering gets you bonuses, too, including early access to the game for some versions.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Preorder Bonus

Preordering any version of Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves gets you an exclusive Terry Bogard skin based on the character's Fatal Fury 2 appearance.

Additionally, digital preorders get you up to three-day early access to the full game starting April 21, 2025.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Special Edition

$60 | Releases April 24

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is available in a Special Edition that includes the base game, the Season 1 DLC with five additional characters, and the Fatal Fury 2 Terry Bogard preorder bonus costume. Note that SNK does not plan to sell the game or Season Pass DLC separately.

Physical PS5, PS4, and Xbox Series X preorders are available at Best Buy. Digital preorders are also available on consoles and PCs.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Deluxe Edition

$80 | Releases April 24

A special PS5-exclusive Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Deluxe Edition is also available for preorder. This $80 version includes the full game, the Season Pass 1 DLC, and a selection of physical collectibles, including:

  • Steelbook case
  • 2-CD Soundtrack
  • 100-plus page art book
  • A collector’s box
  • Stickers

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Deluxe Edition preorders are available at Best Buy, with more retailers expected to list it soon.

Take a closer look at the Deluxe Edition extras below.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves will launch with a 17-character roster that includes a mix of old and new fighters, with five more joining over the months after launch via the Season Pass 1 DLC included with all versions of the game.

Along with standard gameplay modes like online and offline versus mode and arcade mode, the game will also include an RPG mode where players explore South Town, earn XP in battles, and customize their character. There will be control schemes to use; "Arcade Style" uses the classic inputs of previous Fatal Fury games, while "Smart Style" simplifies the controls with direction-based inputs similar to Street Fighter 6's new Modern control mode.

If you're interested in experiencing more of SNK's fighting game history, you can preorder the remaster of the classic crossover fighter, SNK vs. Capcom SVC Chaos, for $35 at Amazon ahead of its February 11 release date. This enhanced port of SNK's 2003 fighting game features a roster of fighters from Fatal Fury, King of Fighters, and Capcom's Street Fighter series. It's been upgraded with full online matchmaking with roll-back net code, art galleries, built-in tournament modes, and more. Physical copies are available for Nintendo Switch and PS4, while digital preorders are available on PS4, Switch, and PC.

You can also see Capcom's side of the rivalry thanks to the inclusion of Capcom vs. SNK 1 and 2 in the upcoming Capcom Fighting Collection 2 for PS4, Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, and PC. The collection also includes several other classic Capcom-published games like Power Stone 1 and 2, Project Justice, Plasma Sword: Nightmare of Bilstein, and more. While no release date has been announced, preorders for the Capcom Fighting Collection 2 are available now, and physical PS4 and Switch copies include a limited-edition Capcom vs. SNK comic.

Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics Amazon Deals:

Fighting game enthusiasts should also check out the recently released Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics compilation. This seven-game compilation received a physical edition last fall, and you can save $20 on PS4 and Nintendo Switch versions at Amazon.

item.title: Balatro Hits Big Sales Milestone After Being Showered With Awards
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/balatro-hits-big-sales-milestone-after-being-showered-with-awards/1100-6528912/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Developer Localthunk has revealed that Balatro has recently passed the 5 million sales milestone across all platforms.

"The last few weeks have been pretty wild. To everyone who picked up Balatro after seeing it at The Game Awards, we hope you're having an amazing time with it," the developer said on Twitter. "If this is your first time picking up an indie title, try to make it a habit!"

The last few weeks have been pretty wild.
To everyone who picked up Balatro after seeing it at @thegameawards, we hope you're having an amazing time with it!
If this is your first time picking up an indie title, try to make it a habit!
There's some amazing stuff out there! pic.twitter.com/ZnRpWnJlTW

— Balatro (@BalatroGame) January 21, 2025

According to Balatro's publisher, Playstack, the 5 million mark doesn't include downloads from Apple Arcade. Additionally, the game was sitting at 3.5 million copies sold at the first week of December, indicating that it received a boost in exposure after being nominated as a Game of the Year candidate at The Game Awards 2024.

Balatro has also been nominated at other awards shows, including the New York Game Awards 2025, the Steam Awards 2024, and the 28th Annual Dice Awards. Balatro is also one of GameSpot's 10 best games of 2024.

In GameSpot's Balatro review, we said, "Balatro's ingenious combination of poker and roguelite gameplay creates an intoxicating combination that's hard to pull away from."
